service_inquiry.h File Reference

The core logic of service inquiry handler module. [CAUTION] When an application uses the APIs in this file, upon exit the application should call destroy_sde_handler_cache() as a part of its memory clean up. More...

Detailed Description

The core logic of service inquiry handler module. [CAUTION] When an application uses the APIs in this file, upon exit the application should call destroy_sde_handler_cache() as a part of its memory clean up.

Function Documentation

void destroy_sde_handler_cache ( void   ) 

Destroyes the already cached data. The cache data are used to speed up SDE sessions. Calling this function repeatedly is safe although the performance of the SDE handler will degrade significantly.

int get_metadata_response ( uint32_t  seq,
struct sde_metadata **  p1,
size_t *  p1_size,
struct sde_metadata_data **  p2,
size_t *  p2_size 
)

Creates the response packets for an sde_get_metadata.

Parameters:
[in] seq the sequence number of the sde_get_metadata packet.
[out] p1 a pointer to a dynamically allocated memory space containing the response packet to be sent first.
[out] p1_size the size of p1 in bytes.
[out] p2 a pointer to a dynamically allocated memory space containing the response packet to be sent after p1.
[out] p2_size the size of p2 in bytes.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.

int get_service_desc_response ( uint32_t  seq,
struct sde_service_desc **  p1,
size_t *  p1_size,
struct sde_service_desc_data **  p2,
size_t *  p2_size,
const struct position *  pos,
uint32_t  pos_len 
)

Creates the response packets for an sde_get_service_desc.

Parameters:
[in] seq the sequence number of the sde_get_service_desc packet.
[out] p1 a pointer to a dynamically allocated memory space containing the response packet to be sent first.
[out] p1_size the size of p1 in bytes.
[out] p2 a pointer to a dynamically allocated memory space containing the response packet to be sent after p1.
[out] p2_size the size of p2 in bytes.
[in] pos the position data contained in the corresponding sde_get_service_desc_data packet. [CAUTION] The caller must sort pos.
[in] pos_len the number of positions in pos.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.
